page.title: 08Farming in Hannington
page.content: Farming is mainly arable. There are 8 farms, seven privately owned, one run as part of a group owned by a finance Co. They are of various sizes. {Arable Crops: Wheat; Hard for bread, soft for feed & biscuits. ; Oats; Human and animal food. Barley; Winter mainly,some spring sown for feed & malting. Oilseed Rape; For oil extraction. {Pasture:}Grass,little permanent,mostly as break crop in corn. {Livestock:}Sheep,1 flock at Hannington farm, others scattered. Cattle; 1 large Dairy Farm at Pitt Hall & a few others kept for beef and milk. Goats; a small herd. Horses;Pleasure/Foxhunting Foxhounds kept at Vyne and Craven Hunt Kennels.
